docs.snippet: While the Central and South American republics decline, at this time, to follow the lead of the United States and break off relations with Germany, they approve President Wilson's stand and refuse to recognize the submarine blockade as legal.
docs.lead_paragraph: While the Central and South American republics decline, at this time, to follow the lead of the United States and break off relations with Germany, they approve President Wilson's stand and refuse to recognize the submarine blockade as legal.
docs.abstract: British Consulate refuses to issue passports to women and children except in case of necessity

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA WARNS GERMANY; Eight Republics Refuse to Recognize Blockade and Indorse Our Attitude. SPAIN TAKES FIRM STAND Holland Holds Aloof and Sweden Sends Refusal;-Cuba Ready to Join Us. Brazilian Note Polite but Firm. Uruguay Says No to Germany. DECIDE TO ARM LINER ST. LOUIS Manifests Kept Secret. Nearing the Danger Zone. Clearances for Europe. Espagne Twice Eluded U-Boats. SHIPS AT OTHER PORTS. Movements Along the Coast to and from the War Zone.

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Feb. 8, (via London.)--The negative answers of most of the Continental neutrals to President Wilson's invitation to join him in breaking off relations with Germany cause satisfaction here.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Feb. 8, (via London.)--The negative answers of most of the Continental neutrals to President Wilson's invitation to join him in breaking off relations with Germany cause satisfaction here.
docs.abstract: Dutch press comment on reply to Pres. Wilson

headline.main: WILSON REBUFFED, IS BERLIN'S VIEW; Refusal of European Neutrals to Join Us in Break Gives Much Satisfaction. SOUTH AMERICA IGNORED Newspapers Think President Must Be Disappointed by Failure to Win European Backing. Says Teutons Sounded the Neutrals. APPROVE REPLY TO WILSON. Dutch Papers Say Holland Cannot Break with Germany. WILSON REBUFFED, IS BERLIN'S VIEW AN EXTENSION TO NEUTRALS? Paris Hears 48 Hours More Was Given for Ships to Reach Port. Chile Will Not Join Us Now. Brazil Also Protests to Austria. Spain Replies in Negative to Wilson Argentina's Reply to President. Americans in Uruguay Laud Wilson

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, March 2. --All the newspapers comment on the Washington disclosures regarding Germany's manoeuvre, and the opinion is expressed generally that President Wilson has acted with great restraint under the circumstances. In this...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, March 2. --All the newspapers comment on the Washington disclosures regarding Germany's manoeuvre, and the opinion is expressed generally that President Wilson has acted with great restraint under the circumstances. In this connection attention is called to the reports ...

headline.main: PLOT CONDEMNED IN SOUTH AMERICA; Press of Argentina and Uruguay Praise Wilson's Restraint in Dealing with Germany.

docs.snippet: Merman intrigue in South America is Intended to involve that continent in a general war as wall as to infuse into the countries there a distrust for the United States, according to information given to a NEW YORK TIMES representative yesterday by a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Merman intrigue in South America is Intended to involve that continent in a general war as wall as to infuse into the countries there a distrust for the United States, according to information given to a NEW YORK TIMES representative yesterday by a prominent business man closely in touch with Latin-Americancan affairs and confirmed in many detalls by resident South Americans both in private and official life.
docs.abstract: Germans said to have engaged in intrigues to cause general war in So. Amer.; report that Chile would ally herself with Uruguay and Brazil against Argentina, Gen. Carranza reported to have played important part in dissension, I. Fabela, Mexican Minister to Argentina, said to have been active in work against the U. S.

headline.main: PLOT TO START WAR IN SOUTH AMERICA; Germans Said to Have Engaged in Widespread Intrigues to Cause a Conflict. URUGUAY IN SERBIA'S ROLE Economic, Religious, and Poiltical Influences Reported Used in Furtherance of Scheme. Attitude of Chile. Power of Clerical Faction.
